events.message: Applicant submitted the personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses and consolidate existing credit card debt.
The application has been categorized under personal loans based on the purpose stated as medical and debt consolidation.
Loan officer Jane Thompson assigned to manage the case and begin initial interactions with the applicant.
Loan officer reviewed the application details, verifying medical expense estimates and current debt statements.
Requested applicant to provide recent medical bills, debt statements, and proof of income for loan processing.
Applicant submitted all requested documentation including hospital bills, credit card statements, and two latest pay stubs.
Credit bureau report obtained showing a moderate credit score with a few late payments reported in the past year.
Risk assessment indicates average borrower risk due to stable employment but outstanding debts.
A loan offer with a 7.5% interest rate and a 36-month repayment term was presented to the applicant for review.
Applicant responded positively, requesting a slight increase in loan amount to cover additional medical costs.
Application escalated to senior underwriter to review the request for increasing the loan amount.
Senior underwriter approved the requested loan increase after evaluating updated financial documents.
Funds were disbursed to applicantâ€™s bank account to facilitate payment of medical bills and consolidate debts.
Loan officer conducted follow-up call confirming that applicant is managing payments comfortably and satisfied with loan terms.
The loan application case was officially closed after successful funding and positive borrower engagement in follow-up.
